name: 羅元隆
objective: The subject is designed to include two professional realms – random vibration and time-frequency domain analysis. The fundamentals of random vibration include statistics, correlation analysis, spectrum estimation, spectral analysis of the SDF system, and so on. The time-frequency domain analysis includes the FFT technique, Hilbert Transform, short-time Fourier Transform, and Wavelet analysis, and so on.
schedule:
Week01/Introduction to Probability Distributions and Averages
Week02/Joint Probability Distributions, Ensemble Averages
Week03/Correlation
Week04/Fourier Analysis
Week05/Spectral Density
Week06/Excitation – Response Relations for Linear Systems
Week07/Transmission of Random Vibration
Week08/Mid-term Exam
Week09/Statistics of Narrow Band Processes
Week10/Accuracy of Measurements
Week11/Digital Spectral Analysis I: Discrete Fourier Transforms
Week12/Digital Spectral Analysis II: Windows and Smoothing
Week13/SDOF Spectral Analysis
Week14/Short-time Fourier Transform
Week15/Hilbert Transform
Week16/Wavelet Analysis and Its Application
Week17/Wavelet Analysis and Its Application
Week18/Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Attendance: 20%
Mid-term Exam: 25%
Final Exam: 25%
Report: 30%
materials:
"An Introduction to Random Vibrations, Spectral & Wavelet Analysis 3/e" by D. E. Newland
"Probability Concepts in Engineering - Emphasis on Applications to Civil and
Environmental Engineering 2/e" by A. H-S Ang & W. H. Tang
